title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: But fear was a thing unknown to theBorder reivers, and the flower of them rode with Buccleuch thatnight--close on his horse's heels Wat o' Harden, Walter Scott ofGoldielands, and Kinmont's own four stalwart sons--Jock, Francie,Geordie, and Sandy.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: But fear was a thing unknown to theBorder reivers, and the flower of them rode with Buccleuch thatnight--close on his horse's heels Wat o' Harden, Walter Scott ofGoldielands, and Kinmont's own four stalwart sons--Jock, Francie,Geordie, and Sandy.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: On the right bank of the Teviot, about two miles above Hawick, stands the ancient tower of Goldielands, one of the most entire now extant upon the Border.

title: Journal of a tour through the Highlands of Scotland during the summer of MDCCCXXIX.
author: Botfield, Beriah
snippet: Nor started at the bugle-horn.*'Upon reaching the ancient house of Branxholm,old associations are, however, revived, which theTower of Goldielands, situated on a bold projectingrock, tends to strengthen, especially when it is recollected that the last owner of tlrls Border fortalicewas hung over his own gate, for March-treason.
